instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I replaced the BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> due to computer getting stuck on Apple Logo.  ASD was failing system Management Engine test.  Now computer boots to user screen, but after password is entered the user will load halfway???  I run ASD again and it still is failing?? Any ideas??

threads.title: BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Now it boots after SMC reset, anyone know what the problem is or was??

threads.title: BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Also there is no serial number listed now under about Mac??

threads.title: BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Your "NEW" chip does not have a clean ME region, you need a clean ME region, the ME region from original bios is also bad......

threads.title: BIOS chip on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: How can I clean the ME region?
